data: My poor friend “Oberon”—[See the sketch or story entitled “The Devil in Manuscript,” in “The Snow-Image, and other Twice-Told Tales.”]—for let me be allowed to distinguish him by so quaint a name—sleeps with the silent ages.
The Devil in Manuscript | The Snow-Image, and other Twice-Told Tales

My poor friend “Oberon”--[See the sketch or story entitled “The Devil in Manuscript,” in “The Snow-Image, and other Twice-Told Tales.”]--for let me be allowed to distinguish him by so quaint a name--sleeps with the silent ages.
Fragments from the Journal of a Solitary Man

Fragments from the Journal of a Solitary Man
(From: "The Doliver Romance and Other Pieces: Tales and Sketches")
